name: Paperback: Memoirs of a Hollywood Soldier
description:
Book Description

Everyday, hundreds of film industry extras get up early to go to work at a place they’ve never been to, usually not having the slightest clue what will happen, nor what will be required of them. They usually don’t get to read a script nor have the luxury of choosing who to work with or having an opinion. Welcome to the world of the Extra, aka walking prop. This is the story of one such extra that was lucky enough, however, to be in the production of his dreams, the set of a Hollywood war movie for HBO's The Pacific.

About the Author

Jeff Ooi was a bored IT Analyst at a large Road Company when he was given an opportunity to be an extra in a 200 million dollar mini-series. There, he took snapshots and kept a journal of his very unique experience. Later when the series finished, he was determined to document the experience properly for his children. The journal has gone from a diary to a picture book, to a blog and now a novel. Jeff describes his first book as not Shakespeare or Steinbeck or even Spike Milligan. The events are presented as-is, unembellished but hopefully entertaining. A must read for any budding actor, extra or even simply a film buff.

    Product Details

    • Description: Limited first edition run of 250 copies, Individually numbered and signed by the Author.
    • Paperback: 110 pages

    • Language: English
    • ISBN-13: 978-0-646-53569-2
    • Product Dimensions: 30 x 20 x 3 cms
    • Shipping: To USA $10.60 , UK $15.30 , Rest of Europe $10-15 , Australia $7.00
    • Shipping Weight (net): 400g

name: Hard Cover: Memoirs of a Hollywood Soldier (only 10 in print)
description:
NOW AVAILABLE

Wow $70 why so expensive?

This is a special edition black hard cover case bound with dust jacket. Expensive? You betcha! I could only do a run of 10 books for starters so it cost me $68 to produce that's why its that dear. Five copies will go to my family. The other five are for purchase by the public.

name: Prize DRAW 21st October ::: Props to be won from "The Pacific"
description:
All purchasers of my book will go into a draw for:

* Japanese Cap as worn by Imperial Japanese Army soldiers during filming
* Japanese Gaiters and Hobnail boots as worn by Imperial Japanese Army soldiers during filming

Both items are from the Propstore of London and will be drawn at Hylands Bookshop 21 October 2010.

Semper Fi!
Banzai!
